review_title: Overall the company is a decent company to work for.
job_title: Counselor Technician in Kansas City, MO
pros: The job pays well, flexible hours and great benefits,
cons: The staff members are unprofessional, they treat the clients horrible, and the supervisors are unprofessional. In addition, the hiring process was unorganized.

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Slightly higher salary in the area for the poor treatment you receive.
cons: Training was insufficient and all supervisors have their own way they do certain things anyway. Supervisors and HR talk down to you as if you are ignorant and beneath them. Supervisors will also put false information in your supervison notes to cover their own behind as having done their job when it actually wasn't done. Productivity and documentation expectations for CSS's are unrealistic as they must be met irregardless of client cancellations, computer down time, scheduled vacation time, or sick leave. Non-performance, even for excused sick leave, earns you a "development plan" due to "poor client services" which goes in your HR file. CSS turn-over is unbelievable! I've NEVER seen anything like it in all my many years of experience! Health insurance is high.

review_title: Upper Management could improve people skills to boost morale...
job_title: in Kansas City, MO
pros: Swope's mission and vision is community directed and many from the community benefit from the services.  I've helped change lives.  It's very rewarding.
cons: The work itself is meaningful, but middle management tends to be out of touch with non management positions and sometimes it seems as if the company tries to rule by intimidation.  This produces unnecessary stress on the revenue generating employees.  There also seems to be a lot of insecurity and distrust among associates...usually in management to non-management positions.    For the reason, the work is rewarding, but office politics dampers the experience.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: This company is a non-for profit organization based on helping people that are under and un-insured get the medical attention that they need.
cons: The people that work at this organization are over worked and under paid. They work long hours and deal with patients that are mentally unstable and lack knowledgeable communication. The work loads are heavy and there is not enough staff to accommodate all of the patients they service.  They are quick to fire or suspend employees that are an asset to the community.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros:
Flexible hours
Ability to help people that are seriously ill
cons:
Managerial skills
Employees integrity 
Revolving door for community support specialist-poor management correlates 
Increase in pay rates are very low and subjective to office politics 
Movement in this company is determined by office politics

job_title: CSS in Kansas City, MO
pros: Swope offers a good health care package.
cons: upper management could stand to be more friendly and understanding of staff below them. Their is a lack of customer service internally.  Swope does not appear to care about the overall morale of the workers in the company.  Swope has made some changes recently that is creating a hostile work environment.  It does not appear that  upper management is willing to make changes to help the revenue producing staff.  At times upper management come off as not caring about the safety of employees who work in the community.  That is concerning.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: There are absolutely no pros about this place.
cons: Politics and BS - RUN! Management will lie on you or set you up for failure faster than you can blink if they want to get rid of you. Be careful when they tell you you're doing a good job. Extremely un organized. Will ask you to falsify documents at times during audits with the state and if you don't? Be prepared for their wrath. Will demote you from your position no matter what it is if they feel like it for whatever reason.
